Package swen221.picturepuzzle.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
swen221.picturepuzzle.model.Board
public class Board extends Object
A Board instance represents a board configuration for a game of PicturePuzzle. It is represented as an image and divided into an array of Cells.
Author:
xueleor

  • Field Details

    • width

      private final int width
      Width of the image (in pixels).

    • dimension

      private final int dimension
      Number of cells in each direction (e.g. 3x3)

    • cells

      private Cell[] cells
      The cells on the board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int[] image, int width, int dimension)
      Construct a new board with the specific image, width and number of cells. The last cell of the board is set to blank.
      Parameters:
      image - The image on the board. *********The image is represented by hexadecimal color, high 8 bits for red, middle 8 bits for green, low 8 bits for blue.
      width - Width of the image.
      dimension - Number of cells in each direction.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the image is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the image is empty or, if cells.length is not a non-null positive integer or, if the image is not divisible by width or, if the number of cells is larger than the number of pixels or, if the image is not square or, if the number of cells is not a perfect square number.

  • Method Details

      the cell at the given position.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Check whether the board is actually completed or not.
      Returns:
      true if the board is completed, false otherwise.

    • apply

      public void apply(Operation operation)
      Apply a given operation to this board.
      Parameters:
      operation - Apply the given operation (e.g. a rotation) to this board.

    • swap

      public void swap(Location l1, Location l2)
      Swap the cells with given location on the board.
      Parameters:
      l1 - Location of the first cell.
      l2 - Location of the second cell.

      Create a horizontal bar of appropriate width
      Returns:

    • divideUpImage

      private static Cell[] divideUpImage(int[] image, int width, int dimension)
      Divide the board into a square array of cells arranged such that the first row of cells comes first, then the second row, etc.
      Parameters:
      image - RGB array of raw image data.
      width - Width of the image
      dimension - Number of cells in horizontal and vertical direction
      Returns:
      an array of Cells.

    • carveOutCell

      private static Cell carveOutCell(int[] image, int width, int dimension, int cx, int cy)
      Given the complete image, construct a new cell at a given cell position on the board. To do this, we need to copy the relevant image data from the image into the cell itself.
      Parameters:
      image - Image being carved up into cells
      width - Width of the image
      dimension - Number of cells in horizontal and vertical direction
      cx - X coordinate for cell to carve out
      cy - Y coordinate for cell to carve out
      Returns:
      Call which has been carved out.
